quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Singer and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, rookie, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the wacky Zappa-esque band that Faith No More front man, Mike Patton, was formerly a member of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Bungle

questions.question: What was the name of the first album of alternative rock group, The Smashing Pumpkins?

options.text: Mellon Collie and the Infinite Sadness

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gish

questions.question: In the song, Jane Said by rock band, Janes Addiction, what affliction is Jane suffering from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heroin Addiction

questions.question: This former lead singer of The Faces had a #1 song in 1977 with Tonights the Night.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rod Stewart

questions.question: This popular alternative rock band from the 90s was a collection of alternative rock producers, who worked with such bands as Nirvana and The Smashing Pumpkins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garbage

questions.question: During a tour with Pigface in the early 90s, this then rookie artist was caught sleeping at a backstage party and woke up to find his trademark dreadlocks snipped from his head by Al Jogenson, the front man of industrial metal band, Ministry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trent Reznor

questions.question: This immensely popular group from the 70s had a #1 hit in 1977 with Im Your Boogie Man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: KC  The Sunshine Band

questions.question: What is the name of the country singer who had a #1 smash hit single in 1977 with Southern Nights?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glen Campbell

questions.question: This husband/wife duo had a #1 hit in 1977 with You Dont Have to be A Star (To Be in My Show).

options.text: Marilyn McCoo and Billy Davis, Jr.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn McCoo and Billy Davis, Jr.

questions.question: What high school buddy did bassist extraordinaire, Les Claypool, of rock band Primus receive his first bass guitar from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Gould

questions.question: When 90s alternative rockers, Weezer, were interviewing new band members, the first audition consisted of a trivia quiz on what subject?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Trek

questions.question: What popular 80s war movie was Corey Glover, lead singer of rock band, Living Color, featured in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Platoon

questions.question: This singer was Torn Between Two Lovers and feeling like a fool in 1977.  What is the name of the female singer that penned this #1 song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary MacGregor

questions.question: What is the name of this female group who had a #1 hit single in 1977 with Best of My Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Emotions

questions.question: What is the name of the singer who had a  #1 smash hit single in 1977 with Undercover Angel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan ODay

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Group and Song
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, singles, kinks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With songs like Make It With You, If, Baby, Im-A Want You, and Every Thing I Own flooding the radio airwaves with a steady stream of relaxing grooves, this 1970s group was destined to become perhaps the softest of the soft rockers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bread

questions.question: Early members of this band, famous for the hit  Itchykoo Park, went on to play with The Who and Humble Pie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Small Faces

questions.question: Who was the lead singer and songwriter of The Kinks, an English band whose early hits included You Really Got Me” and All Day and All of the Night?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Davies

questions.question: My Corona was a #1 hit for The Knack in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This TV star had a 1977 hit with Dont Give Up on Us which peacefully proclaimed that the future of the couples relationship is written in the moonlight, painted on the stars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Soul

questions.question: This group was asking us if we heard about the Lonesome Loser in 79.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little River Band

questions.question: This group was singing about a  Heart Of Glass in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blondie

questions.question: This duo had a huge hit with the song Reunited in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peaches And Herb

questions.question: In his 1977 song Margaritaville Jimmy Buffett describes an easy going lifestyle as a Key West beach bum. In a tragic turn of events, he cuts his heel and has to cruise on back home. What does poor Jimmy step on to cause this to happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a pop top

questions.question: This was the second band to be signed up by Brian Epstein. Their first three singles all went to # 1 in the U.K. - a feat not even accomplished by The Beatles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerry and the Pacemakers

questions.question: What Bruce Springsteen song was a #1 hit for Manfred Manns Earth Band in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blinded By The Light

questions.question: We Are Family was a hit song for this group in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sister Sledge

questions.question: The Animals, led by the Eric Burdon, broke on to the scene with this hit song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: House of the Rising Sun

questions.question: This singer, born Barry Alan Pincus, grew up in Brooklyn, NY and had a #1 song in 1977 with Looks Like We Made It.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Manilow

questions.question: Soft Rock is a genre of rock music characterized by an easy-going ear-pleasing sound with non-confrontational lyrics which focus on love, relationships and everyday life. Which of the following bands would NOT be considered a soft rock group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midnight Star

questions.question: The members of this band, managed by Brian Epstein, were practitioners of the Mersey Beat. The first three singles released by this band were all tunes written by the Beatles.

questions.question: Peter Asher  Gordon Waller - known as Peter  Gordon - had a string of hits such as World Without Love and Nobody I Know.  In addition to recording a few Lennon/McCartney songs, Peter Asher knew Paul McCartney well for another reason. What was it?

options.text: They grew up on the same street.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul was dating Peters sister.
